message_1: What is the pKa value for the conjugate acid of the following organic compound: 4-nitrophenol (C6H5NO3)?
message_2: The pKa value for the conjugate acid of 4-nitrophenol is approximately 7.15. This value indicates the acidity of the compound, with lower pKa values representing stronger acids. In the case of 4-nitrophenol, the presence of the nitro group (-NO2) at the para position increases the acidity due to its electron-withdrawing nature, which stabilizes the negative charge on the phenoxide ion formed after deprotonation.
